title: Valentine's message mum: 'Lisa was caring and beautiful, but tired of fighting and needed to get herself from this world' - Mirror Online

The heartbroken family of a tragic mum who left a loving note to her children before her burnt body was found on a beach has spoken out for the first time since her death. 
Distraught sister Hayley Williams, 35, said little sis Lisa was a "kind and caring" mum who was "tired of fighting and just wanted to go to sleep". 
Lisa Williams, 31, sent a card to her five kids along with their favourite bars of chocolate on January 25 to arrive where they were staying in time for Valentine's Day. She then posted the note to her Facebook page. 
On February 12 her body was found badly burnt at a popular Newry beach in Anglesey, north Wales by a security guard. (Photo: Supplied by Family) 
Hayley told Mirror online: "It's just the nature of what she's done, the level of what she inflicted on herself to get out of this world. 
"As a family we are devastated and our lives have been turned upside down. Lisa was a beautiful and caring mum, daughter, sister, aunt, and cousin. " 
Hayley said Lisa, from nearby Llanfaethlu, was going through an extremely difficult period of her life and tried her hardest to overcome her issues but wasn't able to see a way out. 
Lisa was having problems with her relationship and was currently unable to see her children. Read More Lisa Willams' note left for her children (Photo: Facebook) The mum-of-five has been described by her family as a "fantastic" mum (Photo: Facebook) 
Hayley added: "We've recently had a letter to the family from Lisa. She noted she had a hard time and she was battling some difficulties. 
"She said she was tired of fighting and just wanted to go to sleep. 
"The level she went to, to find a way out is horrific." 
A card, with the Welsh word Cariad (meaning love) on the front, was posted on Lisa's profile with the message: "Hope this arrives in time Valentine's Day." (Photo: Supplied by Family) 
Inside, she tells her "famous five" children how much she cares for them, promising to see them soon. 
The devastating message reads: "I love you all with my Welsh heart, lovely Welsh (parcel), Valentine's treats and chocolate treats. Will see you all soon I promise. Kind hands, kind feet, nice words and sharing is caring." 
Dozens of floral tributes have been left at the scene where Lisa's body was found, including a heartbreaking tribute from her dad. 
The tribute read: “Our Lisa Bach. You'll always be in our hearts. Love you forever. Dad and Rachel.” Lisa looking carefree and happy before her tragic death 
Another said: “I'm lucky yo have called you my friend. Forever in our hearts. G xx.” 
“Shine bright like a diamond Lisa Bach. 
“Looking over your beautiful children until we meet again, love Nash xx.” 
And a note from Sheila and Nick read: “RIP Lisa. Such a sad loss, love from Sheila and Nicky.” 
The "proud" mum-of-five's family have thanked everyone involved for all of the support they have received following Lisa's death. 
"Our thanks go to the security guard that attended the scene and the NHS service involved in her care. 
"We thank our family and friends for all the support through this difficult time and all we ask now is to grieve in peace." 
Police are not treating the death as suspicious and the Coroner is awaiting the pathologist's report. The scene where Lia's body was sadly found (Photo: Daily Post) Dozens of tributes have been left at the scene, including one signed off from "Dad" (Photo: Daily Post) 
District Inspector Jason Higgins said: "The lady, who we believe to be local, was pronounced dead at the scene. 
"Our thoughts are with the family at this very difficult time." 
Operations manager for Holyhead Port Wyn Parry said: "She was found by one of our security details. 
"We are very sad to hear about it, and send our condolences to her family."
